required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A Pilot Study to Explore the Feasibility and Operational Pathways of Incorporating a Wrist-based Blood Pressure Monitoring Device Into the All of Us Research Program

brief_summary.textblock: To observe blood pressure variation in various real-world settings

detailed_description.textblock: This is an observational study, which will utilize a wrist-based blood pressure monitor to explore blood pressure variation in up to 75 participants in various real-world settings. There is no intervention in this study. The study will take place over a 4-week period. During this time, participants will be asked to sample their blood pressures 1) at random times, several times per day; 2) during specific periods of either emotional stress or relaxation; 3) during guided orthostatic testing. Study participants will utilize an application on their smartphones to log the device-measured blood pressures and flag selected blood pressure measurements as either being part of the orthostatic testing or during periods of emotional stress/relaxation. At the close of the study a post-study questionnaire will be sent electronically to each participant.

primary_outcome.description: The primary endpoint for this study is assessing variability in blood pressure measurements (both systolic and diastolic). Blood pressure measurements will be sought over the course of 4 weeks during the following activities: During waking hours (several times a day for at least 2 days out of the week) Orthostatic maneuvers (seated and then 1 minute after standing up) At times of stress and relaxation.

arm_group.arm_group_label: All of Us Research Program (AoURP) consortium members

study_pop.textblock: Members of the All of Us Research Program (AoURP) Participant Center consortium (age > 18 years)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Consortium members within the All of Us Research Program
- ≥18 years of age
- Own an iOS or Android device
Exclusion Criteria:
- Inability to give informed consent
- <18 years of age
- Inability to understand written English language
